I‚Äôm a Computer Science Engineering student who loves coding, problem-solving, and playing around with math. I enjoy breaking complicated logic into simple stuff and then building it back in a smarter way. I explore core computer science concepts mostly out of curiosity. Apart from tech, I‚Äôm really into science and astronomy‚Äîlearning about stars, galaxies, and the crazy physics that keeps the universe running.

When I‚Äôm not coding, you‚Äôll probably find me watching sci-fi series, horror movies, or anime, playing badminton, or experimenting in the kitchen because I genuinely enjoy cooking. I‚Äôm a big fan of cats and pandas, try to stay calm and patient in most situations, and I like being helpful to others. I‚Äôm always enthusiastic about learning, growing, and providing real value wherever I can.

name: Antara Kawathekar
quote: Turning abstract 'whys' into functional 'hows'.
bio:
"If reality is the destination, imagination is the map."
I am Antara Kawathekar, and I have a bit of an obsession with the foundations of things. As a student of Computer Science, I spend my time investigating the thin line where abstract theories meet technical execution.
I believe that to truly innovate, we must be willing to deconstruct reality and look at the 'imaginary' possibilities beneath it. My journey is defined by a persistent curiosity and a commitment to understanding the first principles of every challenge I encounter.

Achievements : Intermediate Drawing exam: A grade, Nagpur Division 10th board topper, awarded for various drawing competitions, participated and got recognised in Raman Science Centers various quizzes
